SENT.plain: A 17-year-old female developed severe aplastic anemia following serologically proven infectious mononucleosis
In vitro studies, using the granulocyte colony forming technique, suggested that the aplasia may have resulted from an immune mechanism
The patient's marrow grew no granulocyte colonies and caused inhibition of colony formation when mixed with normal marrows
The patient recovered fully after therapy with antithymocyte globulin and marrow cultures showed disappearance of the inhibitory effect
These observations suggest that the severe aplasia may have resulted from an aberrant immune response which followed infection by EB virus
